item.description: When playing a CTF, you are on the look out for flags. A flag usually looks something like this: 1 flag{some_message} There is a standardized format of flag{.
Some terminology you may find helpful as you proceed: Encryption. A process and method which takes plaintext and produces ciphertext that can be sent to another party, or stored.
Asking Forensics Questions So you are looking at some piece of evidence. Evidence could be anything from a website, to an image, to even simply a piece of text.

item.title: Forensics Intro
item.description: Forensics is the art of recovering the digital trail left on a computer. There are plently of methods to find data which is seemingly deleted, not stored, or worse, covertly recorded.

item.title: What are file formats?
item.description: File Extensions are not the sole way to identify the type of a file, files have certain leading bytes called file signatures which allow programs to parse the data in a consistent manner.

item.title: What is a hex editor?
item.description: A hexadecimal (hex) editor (also called a binary file editor or byte editor) is a computer program you can use to manipulate the fundamental binary data that constitutes a computer file.

item.title: What is disk imaging?
item.description: A forensic image is an electronic copy of a drive (e.g. a hard drive, USB, etc.). It’s a bit-by-­bit or bitstream file that’s an exact, unaltered copy of the media being duplicated.

item.title: What is memory forensics?
item.description: There are plenty of traces of someone’s activity on a computer, but perhaps some of the most valuble information can be found within memory dumps, that is images taken of RAM.

item.title: What is metadata?
item.description: Metadata is data about data. Different types of files have different metadata. The metadata on a photo could include dates, camera information, GPS location, comments, etc.

item.title: What is steganography?
item.description: Stegonagraphy is the practice of hiding data in plain sight. Stegonagraphy is often embedded in images or audio. You could send a picture of a cat to a friend and hide text inside.

item.title: What is wireshark?
item.description: Wireshark is a network protocol analyzer which is often used in CTF challenges to look at recorded network traffic. Wireshark uses a filetype called PCAP to record traffic.
